description.narrative: By 2017, in selected districts and municipalities, parents' and stakeholders' support quality alternative learning opportunities for out-of-school girls and boys, and improve education attendance and retention of girls and boys, from early childhood to adolescence, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, in selected areas, children, adolescents, women and men, and all relevant duty-bearers are engaged in social change and action to realize the survival, development, protection and participation rights of children, adolescents and women with equity in all contexts, including humanitarian situations

sector.narrative: Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities

UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, in selected districts and municipalities, parents’ and stakeholders’ support quality alternative learning opportunities for out-of-school girls and boys, and improve education attendance and retention of girls and boys, from early childhood to adolescence

description.narrative: With the support of UNICEF, 6,462 children (6,028 girls and 434 boys) accessed Non Formal Education (NFE). Of these, 85 per cent (5,346 girls and 199 boys) completed the full cycle of non-formal classes and 92 per cent were mainstreamed into formal education. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: % of girls and boys enrolled in Non-Formal Education mainstreamed to formal system in priority districts (disaggregated by ethnicity and wealth)

actual.value: 2017:92% boys and girls enrolled in NFE were mainstreamed into the formal system. Girls 91%, Boys 5%, Dalit 91%, Janajati 75%, Muslims 90%

title.narrative: % of Non-Formal Education class starters (age and gender disaggregated) completing the full cycle

actual.value: 2017:72 per cent of adolescents from 3 programme districts who completed life skills and non-formal education and changed their knowledge, attitudes and practices.

title.narrative: % of disadvantaged female and male caregivers perceiving the importance of education from early childhood to grade 8 in 15 priority districts (disaggregated by age, gender, wealth, ethnicity)

target.value: 2017:20% increase from the baseline in 15 districts

actual.value: 2017:Proxy indicator taken from MICS 2014. Perception of minimum years of schooling, percentage of mothers who would like their child to attend at least grade 8 - 84.3%
